group = ['male','female']
plt.bar(group,[male.shape[0],female.shape[0]])
plt.bar(group,[male_survived,female_survived])

source.8b6301c8:
first_class = train[train.Pclass==1]
second_class = train[train.Pclass==2]
third_class = train[train.Pclass==3]
source.5f39a604:
first_class_survived = first_class[first_class.Survived==1]
second_class_survived = second_class[second_class.Survived==1]
third_class_survived = third_class[third_class.Survived==1]

group = ['first','second','third']
plt.bar(group,[len(first_class),len(second_class),len(third_class)])
plt.bar(group,[len(first_class_survived),len(second_class_survived),len(third_class_survived)])
plt.legend(['Total','Survived'])
plt.xlabel("Passenger Class")
plt.ylabel("Number of Passengers")
source.6556b1bd:
df_pc = train.groupby(['Survived', 'Pclass']).size().reset_index()
df_pc['percentage'] = train.groupby(['Survived', 'Pclass']).size().groupby(level=1).apply(lambda x: 100 * x / float(x.sum())).values
df_pc.columns = ['Survived', 'Pclass', 'Counts', 'Percentage']
df_pc

## Explanatory Data Analysis

Initially we will utilize some basic funtions of pandas to get an overview on the dataset.
source.f7f1411b:
### Initial Insights 

So there are 891 samples and 12 columns in the dataset. Among these samples 86 samples are without age record, and 327 samples are without cabin record.

Age value can be synthesised from Name (Mr, Ms, Mrs, etc). But for now, we are going to ignore that.
